description: After applying the updates associated with CVE-2024-38053, users may experience unexpected and unauthorized remote code execution on systems utilizing the Windows Layer-2 Bridge network driver. This issue affects various builds of Windows 10 and 11, including 10.0.22631.3880, 10.0.22621.3880, 10.0.19045.4651, and 10.0.22000.3079. End users might notice their system behaving erratically, unauthorized applications running without user consent, and unusual network activity indicating potentially compromised security. The updates linked to this issue are documented in KB-5040448, KB-5040442, and KB-5040431, and the impact of the vulnerability is rated important, necessitating prompt remediation actions.
